title: Trump ramps up pressure on Iran by deploying aircraft carrier and threatening strikes
subhead: The US president ordered Tehran to reach a nuclear agreement or face 'far worse' attacks than those of June 2025. Washington continues to concentrate military assets in the Gulf.

title: PFAS: Pollution in the EU could cost up to €1.7 trillion
Starmer's China visit symbolizes Western leaders' shift amid unease with Trump
French groups decry end of Gaza asylum program for artists and scientists
subhead: French organizations say they have been told they are no longer eligible for the Pause program run by the Collège de France, and are urging the government to reverse what they call a 'discriminatory' decision.

title: Fed halts rate cuts amid dollar plunge and pressure from Trump
subhead: On Wednesday, the US Federal Reserve kept its key interest rates steady between 3.5% and 3.75%. The dollar hit its lowest point since 2022.

title: Ali Akbar, Paris's last newspaper hawker, honored by Macron
subhead: The French president presented Ali Akbar with one of the French government's highest honors on Wednesday evening. Akbar has sold Le Monde for decades in the Saint-Germain-des-Prés neighborhood of Paris.

title: At the Paris Opera, Ralph Fiennes brings refined pleasures to 'Eugene Onegin'
subhead: The new production of Tchaikovsky's lyrical masterpiece received a standing ovation at the Palais Garnier, notably showcasing Ukrainian tenor Bogdan Volkov as Lensky.

title: Danish PM cites 'some lessons learned' by EU from Trump's Greenland threats

French Sénat adopts a bill to ease the return of colonial-era artifacts to their countries of origin

Sweden lowers criminal responsibility to age 13

'For sure': Two impromptu words by Macron go viral
Work-related cancers remain a blind spot in France's public health system
subhead: A study conducted by doctors and occupational sociologists at the Avignon Hospital Center on over 500 lymphoma patients found there was a 'massive underestimation' of work-related cancers in France.

title: How India and the EU created a common market to counter Trump
subhead: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and representatives of the European Union concluded a trade agreement on January 27, after nearly 20 years of intermittent negotiations, opening up a market of nearly two billion people.

title: Why there are so many French presidential hopefuls
subhead: As a result of political fragmentation, the growing number of figures who have declared their candidacies or are thinking about doing so is making the 2027 presidential election highly uncertain, writes Le Monde's Solenn de Royer in her column.

title: The need to speak truth about immigration
Europe: 'A new social federalism must be invented as the response of democratic states to empires'
